item.title: Frequent Fly-Tipping, 16th February
item.description:
These rubbish have been here for more than two months now. Someone or some low life people have been dumping here many times before. Greenwich council does not seem to be doing enough. Hope Peadbody sort this out quickly and investigate these culprits. Things are getting worse!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Silver Birch Close, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping lrg tall box full of rubbish, 16th February
item.description:

item.title: Deep potholes some minor but a few along this whole road, 16th February
item.description:
It’s been months I’ve encountered across this road various potholes some small some big m. Please sort it out it’s causing damage to cars driving. You have a right as a council to get this sorted immediately
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tower Bridge Road, Old Kent Road, Greater London

item.title: In front of 6 Caver Road. Dangerous broken pavement, 16th February
item.description:
One large paving stone rocks significantly when stood on. It is next to a dip resulting from another stone that has broken in half and some uneven tarmacking at the kerb. The rocking of the stone raises its edges causing a trip hazard for pedestrians. The recent rain has resulted in more soil being washed away from under the stone and causing its movement to get worse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Carver Road, Dulwich Village, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hackney have left tarmac for over one month, 16th February
item.description:
It’s unacceptable that Hackney council resurfaced a section of the pavement and have left the old tarmac dumped for over one month. It’s illegal and mal practice. Ensure Hackney clean up their mess and remove this .

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): De Beauvoir Estate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipping on Woolwich Road, 15th February
item.description:
Hi there, Can you please clean the fly tipping on Woolwich Road asap? That busy road ought to be cleaned weekly as scheduled but that hardly even happens. Please sort that out. Best, L

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woolwich Road, Greenwich
